instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.message: when <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, is bad it produce some resistance and we get 1.3 v  and problem.. in my case, its 1.5v which is perfect

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , unexpected shut down..... also when playing game
threads.message: Do keep in mind that output on the rail <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is on changes based on load, it has the ability to output multiple voltages.

wow i had 2nd board, that is fixed too!!!! i use caps from a 2013 donner mac air board.  high quality caps....newer too....

i think when gpu need high power (when play game etc) from that power rail ... caps cant hold too much power and gpu turned off whole system.... if we put more powerful caps this prob will never come back fro sure.... duke 

what would be more powerful caps which can hold more current ?

threads.title: [solved]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a , unexpected shut down..... also when playing game
threads.message: Tantalum caps can go bad, no more science than that....
